data.name: Find PPI
data.description:
In this Kata you need to write the FindPPI function, which takes the screen resolution and its diagonal, and returns the number of pixels per inch screen.

ppi formula:

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" id="body_1" width="170" height="70">

<g transform="matrix(1.3333334 0 0 1.3333334 0 0)">
    <image  x="0" y="0" xlink:href="data:image/png;base64," width="127.5" height="52.5"/>
</g>
</svg>

Where

wp is width resolution in pixels

hp is height resolution in pixels
 
di is diagonal size in inches (this is the number advertised as the size of the display).

Since many display manufacturers round PPI as they want, the function should return the value with one digit after the point.

Example:
```
('1920x1080', 21.5) --> 102.4
```
